education.field_of_study: International Treaties related to Environment and Food

awards.title: 2011 Winner African Enterprise Challenge Fund (AECF) (member winning team)
awards.description: I was part of the team that wrote a proposal to offer low-cost infrared spectroscopy analyses to farmers in Kenia and its neighboring countries. Its goal is to establish soil and organic material data that will be available for BLGG and poor farmers. In this way farmers will be able to have an enriched understanding of their crops, soil characteristics and mineral management, resulting in better yields and cost reductions.

awards.title: 2010  Winner NGI Venture Challenge (member winning team)
awards.description: Our team had the privilege of winning this competition by developing the idea for the company Clear Detections. This company offers innovative nematode detection and PCR technologies.

profile_positions.description:
• Research in the field of Disaster Risk Reduction 
• Writing of multi-year proposals 
• Creation of program annual budgets, workplans and logical frameworks
• Communication with donors 
• Writing of annual reports 
• Program fundraising 
• Design and creation of monitoring and evaluation system 
• Developing professional skills through trainings 
• Keeping track of all program expenses 
• Develop program training modules 
• Manage program logistics 
• Communicate with government authorities and obtain program permissions
• Training of local program facilitators

I started a Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) Program for my Non-Governmental-Origanization (NGO) in Central Asia. Its goal is to move away from disaster relief and to focus on disaster prevention and mitigation. First, after completing research into the characteristics of vulnerabilities, capacities and hazards in communities. The goal was to find out what kind of DRR methods fitted our organization and -moreover- the needs and abilities of affected communities. This resulted in a program that connected with community development programs of the NGO I worked at.

The program consisted of training modules and the facilitation of disaster management tools. These tools were the establishment of a Community Disaster Management Committee (CDMC), a Community Cased Contingency Plan (CBCP) and a Community Based Disaster Savings Fund (CBDS). In some cases the trainings were combined with a small material component (e.g. distribution of socks or rubber boots).The program training materials were designed based on the research, interviews with affected people, exchange of ideas with partner NGO's and input from local facilitators.

The program was focused on extreme winter conditions and flooding during spring season.
Further plans included the development of an Advocacy Strategy, a Community Based Early Warning System and the exploration of Climate Change Adaptation measures.

profile_positions.description:
• Research Project: Disaster Risk Reduction and Urban Flooding, Gujarat State, India.
• Fieldwork for agency articles and Msc. Thesis Wageningen University
• Interviews with affected populations, authorities
• Publishing articles in southasiadisasters.net

I researched the problem of urban flooding in the state of Gujarat, India.The goal of the research was to understand the causes of the floods and to find ways to optimize humanitarian assistance to the most vulnerable people in the area.
